greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Unreduced binary digital mean numerators, dm_num(2, n).
comment: The first column of A144912 begins at n = 2. Zeros in that column correspond to A031443.
Compare A037861, which is the negative of this sequence beginning at n = 1.
Also: number of 1's minus number of 0's in the binary representation of n. - _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 08 2018
formula: dm_num(2, n) = sigma(i in [1, d]: d_i * 2 - 1), where d is the number of digits in the binary representation of n and d_i the individual digits.
Let f(n) = A000120(n) = log2[A001316(n)] = log2[2 * A001316(n - 1) / A006519(n)]. Then a(n) = a(n - 1) + 2 * (f(n) - f(n - 1)), subtracted by 1 if f(n) equals 1. - _Reikku Kulon_, Oct 02 2008
program: a145037 n = a145037 n' + 2*m - 1 where (n', m) = divMod n 2
xref: Cf. A145057 (terms equal differences between n where a(n) equals zero).
results.author: _Reikku Kulon_, Sep 30 2008
